intro: Aidia oxyodonta, commonly known as the white-flowered aidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white, five-petaled flowers. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Aidia oxyodonta is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
